intro: Bastardiastrum wissaduloides, commonly known as the Wissaduloides bladderwort, is a rare aquatic plant belonging to the family Limnophyceae. It is characterized by its small, bladder-like structures that aid in buoyancy and gas exchange. The plant typically grows in shallow, freshwater habitats such as ponds and wetlands. Its morphology includes filamentous growth patterns and specialized cells for absorbing nutrients from the water. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a sensitive indicator of water quality.
